reporting.config.email.delivery.method.f: The email(s), one per line, where the report should be sent.
Required. One email per line. Emails must be formatted properly (email@domain.com)
This password will be used to secure the zip file. It will be encrypted when stored in the database.
Required. Password must not be blank.
The type of data this report should contain. If this is an old report, you will not be able to change this field, and should create a new report
admin.portal.reporting.config.report.typ: The type this report should be sent as, e.g. CSV
admin.portal.reporting.config.delivery.m: The method in which the data should be sent
The frequency interval (daily, weekly, or monthly) that the report should be sent
admin.portal.reporting.config.day.of.mon: The day of the month to send the report. This field is required and only valid when the frequency is monthly
admin.portal.reporting.config.day.of.wee: The day of the week to send the report. This field is required and only valid when the frequency is weekly
admin.portal.reporting.config.hour.of.da: The hour of the day to send the report, in Eastern Standard Time (EST). This is required for all frequency settings
admin.portal.reporting.config.pgp.encryp: The key for encryption, if PGP encrypted file is required
admin.portal.reporting.config.enable.com: Specifies whether report should be compressed. Without compression files will not be password protected or encrypted.
admin.portal.reporting.config.include.da: Specifies whether the report's filename should include the date.
admin.portal.reporting.config.enterprise: The catalogs that should be included in the report. No selection means all catalogs will be included.
admin.portal.reporting.config.error.subm: There was an error submitting, please try again.
reporting.config.sftp.delivery.method.fo: The port the sftp host connects to
Required. Must be a valid port
The username to securely access the host
The password to use to securely access the host. The password will be encrypted when stored in the database
Required. Password must not be blank
The path on the host to deliver the report to
Required. File path cannot be blank

advance.analytics.engagement.tab.heading: Engagement
advance.analytics.engagement.tab.descrip: This tab displays metrics that measure your learners’ engagement with learning content. Use the date range and filters section to filter all the visualizations below it on the page. Dig deeper into the specific topics by downloading their associated CSVs.
advance.analytics.outcomes.tab.heading: Outcomes
advance.analytics.outcomes.tab.descripti: This tab displays metrics that describe the outcomes of your learners engaging with learning content, including completions and skills gained. Use the date range and filters section to filter all the visualizations below it on the page. Dig deeper into the specific topics by downloading their associated CSVs.
advance.analytics.progress.tab.heading: Progress
advance.analytics.progress.tab.descripti: This tab displays metrics that describe your learners and their learning progress, as well as popular subjects and courses in your organization. Use the date range and filters section to filter all the visualizations below it on the page. Dig deeper into the specific topics by downloading their associated CSVs.

highlights.new.highlights.stepper.steppe: Create a title for your highlight
Create a unique title for your highlight. This title is visible to your learners and helps them navigate to relevant content.

Pro tip: we recommend naming your highlight collection to reflect skills it aims to develop, or to draw the attention of specific groups it targets. For example, "Recommended for Marketing" or "Develop Leadership Skills".

adminPortal.productTours.adminOnboarding: Next
Back
Keep going
admin.portal.productTours.adminOnboardin: Select any item in the guide to learn more about your administrative portal.
We're excited to show you the edX administrative portal. Use our {bold_tag}Quick Start Guide{bold_tag} to get step-by-step guidance on what our portal can do for you.
We've launched a new {bold_tag}Quick Start Guide{bold_tag}, which provides step-by-step guidance on what our portal can do for you.
You haven't completed all the steps yet. You can revisit the guide anytime--just click the help icon in the bottom right corner.
adminPortal.productTours.adminOnboarding: Track learner activity and progress across courses with the Learner Progress Report.
Get a high-level view of learner enrollments, course completions, and more.
Scroll down for a detailed, twice-daily updated progress report.
Access the full Learner Progress Report here.
View module-level details for Executive Education courses.
Filter results by course, start date, or learner email.
Export the report as a CSV to gain insights and organize data efficiently.
Create learner groups, view all learners in your organization, and access individual learner profiles—all in one place.
Once learners join the organization, you can create learner groups, view all learners in your organization, and access individual learner profiles—all in one place.
View all learners in your organization. Search by name and access profiles to track progress and view learning access.
"View more" allows you to see the learner's full profile with enrollments, access type, and group memberships at a glance.
Organize learners by creating groups for tracking and assignments.
When you're ready, use "Create Group" to get started. Learn more.
View, manage, and create your learner groups here.
“Create Group" allows you to add more learner groups. Learn more.
"View group" allows you to edit group details, add and remove learners, or track learner's progress.
Explore insights about your learners and their enrollments. Adjust date ranges, granularity, and analytics type to view data on enrollments, engagement completions, leaderboards, and skills tracking.
Adjust the date range and granularity to customize the data displayed below.
See quick metrics for Enrollments, Distinct Courses, Daily Sessions, Learning Hours, and completions at a glance.
Use the Enrollments, Engagements, and Completions tabs to view learner activity from different perspectives. Scroll down for a breakdown of metrics by Course, Subject, and Individual.
See your top learners ranked by learning hours. Download the CSV for more detailed insights. Only learners who completed a course and at least one engagement activity are included.
Discover the most in-demand skills in your organization based on course enrollments and completions. Use these insights to understand learner interests and skill development trends.
Manage your subscription plans and give learners access to self-enroll in courses. Invite learners, track usage, and manage licenses--all in one place.
The list below shows active and expired subscription plans for you to view and manage.
"Manage learners" allows you to view more details about a plan. Let's view your learners now.
On the subscription plan details page, you can check the expiration date, invite learners, and manage licenses.
"Invite Learners" allows you to invite learners to your subscription plan.
The License Allocation section lets you see invited learners, track license status, and revoke licenses as needed.
Use filters to sort invited learners by license status or search by email address.
To view more plans, navigate back to Subscription Management using this button or the main menu.
Manage Learner Credit budgets to invite learners to enroll or assign courses directly.
Let's view your Assignment budget.
Let's view your Browse and Enroll budget.
The budget detail card provides an overview of your budget, including its type, expiration date, and balance.
The budget provides an overview of your budget, including its expiration date, type, access permissions, and balance.
"New Assignment" allows you to assign courses to learners from your catalog.
Track all budget activity, including enrollment spending using the “Activity” tab.
"New members" can be used to invite learners to utilize this budget.
Track all budget activity, including pending assignments and enrollment spending.
Once learners are using this budget, you'll be able to track all activity, including enrollment spending on the "Activity" tab.
Use the Catalog tab to browse courses available to your learners.
Use the Catalog tab to browse available courses and assign them directly to learners.
View all learners invited to this budget, along with their status (Accepted, Invited, Removed), enrollments, and the option to remove members from the budget.
The Assigned table helps you monitor learner assignments, send reminders, or cancel as needed.
Once you assign courses, you can monitor learner assignments, send reminders, or cancel as needed.
The Spent table allows you to review spending details for this budget.
Use the Catalog tab to browse available courses and assign them directly to learners.
To view more budgets, return to Learner Credit Management using the breadcrumbs or left-hand navigation.
Review and manage course requests from your learners.
Customize reports
Automate reporting on learner engagement, progress, and catalog activity. Set up reports to be delivered to your email daily, weekly, or monthly for easy tracking.
Set up preferences
Customize and configure your portal to fit your organization's needs. Set up branding, manage learner access, enable SSO, and integrate learning platforms—all in one place.
Great job!
You've completed the Quick Start Guide and are ready to administer learning. Need a refresher? Access this guide anytime from the help icon below.
lcm.budget.detail.page.catalog.tab.cours: Learners will be notified of this course assignment by email.

Learners must complete enrollment for this assignment by {courseEnrollmentDeadline}. This deadline is calculated based on the course enrollment deadline or {assignmentEnrollmentDeadline} days past the date of assignment, whichever is sooner.
Impact on your Learner Credit budget
lcm.budget.detailsPage.catalog.tab.cours: The total assignment cost will be earmarked as "assigned" funds in your Learner Credit budget so you can't overspend.
lcm.budget.detail.page.catalog.tab.cours: The course cost will automatically convert from "assigned" to "spent" funds when your learners complete registration.
You will be able to monitor the status of this assignment by reviewing your Learner Credit Budget activity.
You can cancel this course assignment or send email reminders any time before learners complete enrollment.

learner.credit.management.empty.state.no: No budget activity yet? Invite learners to browse the catalog and request content!
learner.credit.management.empty.state.in: Use the Settings tab in this budget to select the authentication method that will allow learners to access the catalog.
learner.credit.management.empty.state.le: Learners can then browse the catalog associated with this budget and request a course that aligns with their interests.
learner.credit.management.empty.state.ap: Once approved, the total cost of the requested course will be deducted from your budget, and you can track your spending right here!

adminPortal.settings.access.subsidyTypeS: Select a subsidy type to distribute. Learners will browse and request courses from the associated catalog.
Setting your selection to "{selectedSubsidyType}" is permanent, and can only be changed through customer support.
adminPortal.settings.configureAccess.des: Allow learners without a subsidy to browse the catalog and request enrollment to courses.
adminPortal.settings.configureAccess.acc: Channels determine how learners access the catalog(s). You can select one or both and change your selection at any time.
adminPortal.settings.apiCredentialsTab.a: Copy and paste the following credential information and send it to your API developer(s).

adminPortal.settings.learningPlatformTab: Are you sure you want to delete this learning platform integration? Once deleted, any saved integration data will be lost.
Select the LMS or LXP you want to integrate with edX For Business.
You do not have any learning platforms integrated yet.

edX For Business seamlessly integrates with many of the most popular Learning Management Systems (LMSes) and Learning Experience Platforms (LXPs), enabling your learners to discover and access all the same world-class edX content from a single, centralized location.
At least one active Single Sign-On (SSO) integration is required to configure a new learning platform integration.
Your configuration data will be saved under your Learning Platform settings
At least one Single Sign On configuration is needed to create an LMS configuration
adminPortal.settings.sso.error.heading: Something went wrong behind the scenes
adminPortal.settings.sso.error.message: We were unable to {action} your SSO configuration due to an internal error. Please try again in a couple of minutes. If the problem persists, contact enterprise customer support.
adminPortal.settings.ssoConfigAlert.inte: Your SSO configuration failed due to an internal error. Please try again by selecting “Configure” below and verifying your integration details. Then reconfigure, reauthorize, and test your connection.
adminPortal.settings.ssoConfigAlert.inpu: Please verify integration details have been entered correctly. Select “Configure” below and verify your integration details. Then reconfigure, reauthorize, and test your connection.
adminPortal.settings.ssoConfigAlert.inPr: Your SSO Integration is in progress
edX is configuring your SSO. This step takes approximately five minutes. You will receive an email at {contactEmail} when the configuration is complete
edX is configuring your SSO. This step takes approximately fifteen seconds.
adminPortal.settings.ssoConfigAlert.unte: You need to test your SSO connection
adminPortal.settings.ssoConfigAlert.test: Your SSO configuration has been completed, and you should have received an email with the following instructions:
1: Copy the URL for your Learner Portal dashboard below:
2: Launch a new incognito or private window and paste the copied URL into the URL bar to load your Learner Portal dashboard.
3: When prompted, enter login credentials supported by your IDP to test your connection to edX.
Return to this window after completing the testing instructions. This window will automatically update when a successful test is detected.
adminPortal.settings.ssoConfigAlert.live: Great news! Your test was successful and your new SSO integration is live and ready to use.
adminPortal.settings.sso.enabled.tooltip: The integration is verified and working
adminPortal.settings.sso.notValidated.to: This integration has not been validated. Please follow the testing instructions to validate your integration.
adminPortal.settings.ssoConfigForm.descr: Connect to a SAML identity provider for single sign-on to allow quick access to your organization's learning catalog.
adminPortal.settings.noSSOCard.title: You don't have any SSOs integrated yet.
adminPortal.settings.noSSOCard.descripti: SSO enables learners who are signed in to their enterprise LMS or other system to easily register and enroll in courses on edX without needing to sign in again. edX for Business uses SAML 2.0 to implement SSO between an enterprise system and edX.org.
sso.error.logo.title: edX logo title
sso.error.title: We're sorry.
sso.error.subtitle: Something went wrong.
sso.error.stepper.network.error.text: We were unable to configure your SSO due to an internal error.
sso.error.lp.network.error.text: We were unable to load your SSO details due to an internal error.
sso.error.try.again: Please close this window and try again in a couple of minutes. If the problem persists, contact enterprise customer support.
adminPortal.settings.sso.unsavedChangesM: Your in-progress data will not be saved.
Your SSO connection will not be active until you restart and complete the SSO configuration process.
adminPortal.settings.sso.newConfiguratio: Only one SSO integration is supported at a time.

To continue updating and editing your SSO integration, select "Cancel" and then "Configure" on the integration card. Creating a new SSO configuration will overwrite and delete your existing SSO configuration.
admin.portal.subscription.expiration.ban: This subscription plan's end date has passed

Your subscription contract is expiring soon
Your current subscription contract will expire in {contractExpirationDays} days. Renew your subscription today to minimize access disruption for your learners.
adminPortal.subscriptionExpiration.modal: Your subscription contract expired on {expirationDate}. The edX customer support team is here to help! Get in touch today to renew your subscription and access your subscription management details.
admin.portal.subscription.expiration.mod: Your subscription contract expires in {expirationDays} days
It's time to renew your subscription contract with edX! The edX customer support team is here to help. Get in touch today to minimize access disruptions for your learners.

adminPortal.settings.ssoConfigAuthorizeS: Please verify authorization of edX as a Service Provider.
Authorize edX as a Service Provider
Action required in a new window
Return to this window after completing the following steps in a new window to finish configuring your integration.
1. Download the edX Service Provider metadata as an XML file:
2. {downloadLink} and upload the XML file to the list of authorized SAML Service Providers on your Identity Provider's portal or website.
Return to this window and check the box once complete
I have authorized edX as a Service Provider
adminPortal.settings.ssoConfigConfigureS: Please enter an OAuth Root URL.
Please enter an API Root URL.
Please enter an OAuth User ID.
Please enter the SAML user attributes from your Identity Provider. All attributes are space and case sensitive.
URN of the SAML attribute containing the username.
URN of the SAML attribute that edX can use as a unique, persistent user ID.
URN of SAML attribute containing the user's full name.
URN of SAML attribute containing the user's first name.
URN of SAML attribute containing the user's last name.
URN of SAML attribute containing the user's email address[es].
URN of SAML attribute containing the user's country of residence.
The URL hostname is what you see upon login to SuccessFactors BizX system, typically aligned with the IDP Entity ID.
The BizX OData API service hostname, typically aligned with the IDP entity ID.
The BizX company profile identifier for your tenant.
The Private Key value found in the PEM file generated from the OAuth2 Client Application Profile.
Username of the BizX administrator account that is configured for edX by the customer.
